instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: if you try to turn it on normally the fan just spins for one second. if you hold the power button for about 5-6 seconds it turns on and runs normally. everything functions and i did an apple diag test and it passes. if you restart the machine it restarts normally. but if you shut down it wont turn on unless you hold the power button for 5-6 seconds again. this is with and without a battery. i assume this is not acting correctly because it wont turn on by itself. no battery and plugged in to power it wont auto start

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: Remove trackpad flex and try again without battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: already tried that, and just tried it again, still same just turns the fan on for one second

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: This board should turn on and off 3 times after remove battery, did you let it 1 min to do the process?? inspect for liquid damage the power board and flex and the logic board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: tried with a known good power board and cable. and already ran this threw water damage treatment. as this was water damaged, forgot to mention that

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: Check sense resistor circuits of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: there was a break between <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7150</CAPACITOR> and the probe point 790 so i ran a jumper between all 3 points and it started to work. can you explain how it was still able to be bypassed by holding down the power button? and how it passed apple hardware diag? im glad you had an idea where to look and im grateful for the help but i would like to learn how you came to the answer to check current  between the pins for a weird power issue like this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B only turnes on if you hold the power button
threads.message: It bypasses the SMC detecting an over current through AMON or BMON lines.
